title: Mouse 4 & 5 Buttons Not working after Windows 10 Major Update
body:
Yesterday, Windows 10 Updated itself with some big update. After that, Mouse 4 and 5 buttons stopped working in League of Legends (and ONLY in League of Legends). Works fine in other programs and games.

Any idea why this is? I realize this might be a Windows-specific issue, but it IS quite annoying not being able to use the ping-shortcuts that I'm used to.

I found a similar thread over on the EUW boards, so I know it's not an issue only for me. (https://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-en/7sijdqWI-rival-300-side-buttons-not-assigning-in-game-since-windows-10-update?show=new)

If anyone has a solution, please enlighten us!
**
UPDATE: We have several solutions posted here! If you are one of the lucky ones who recently updated, you can revert your update. If not, scroll down here to find other solutions that might work for you.**

replies.body:
I want to share a solution with you, which worked for me with my Logitech Mouse, because the other solutions (like remove the other devices) did not work for me and I also did not want to rollback the Windows Update. There is a tool called "Logitech Setpoint" (possibly, there are similar tools for other manufacturers). In this tool you can define customized keyboard-shotcuts instead of the standard functions of the mouse buttons.
For example: I change Button 4 from "forward" to "Ctrl+D" and Button 5 from "backward" to "Ctrl+F". As soon, as I did this, the league client (also ingame) accepted the buttons, and I could re-assign them and my problem is solved.

By the way: in the setpoint tool, you can also do that just seperate for certain applications, so the main forward/backward - function in browsers etc. can stay. Info: the league game client is located in: ...\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\solutions\lol_game_client_sln\releases\xyz\deploy

This worked great. Razer has a similar software called Razer Synapse. I bound my side mouse buttons to 5 and 6 and it works in game. Great idea, and if anyone else is having this issue and doesn't want to revert updates, use this as a solution. Thanks for the great suggestion!
Had the same issue on my Razer mouse, great solution!
Thank you so much, I was using these Keys for Summoner Spells so I wasnt able after 5 years displace them! You are a god for finding this solution 10 Thumbs!!

For the most part, you cannot rebind the mouse buttons in League. We have it set up in a way so that players cannot unintentionally rebind the most important keybinds (such as left clicking and champion movement with right clicking). 

You won't be able to get those keys bound through the normal methods, but if you reach out to our tech team via [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) they might be able to get something worked out for you!

You misunderstand, sir. The buttons that I am trying to get to work are the buttons on the **side** of my mouse, the ones that usually serve to navigate (back and forward) in a typical Internet browser. My left and right  (typically called Mouse 1 and Mouse 2) buttons work fine, and they do not need to be rebound.

What's more is that those affected buttons are **already** bound in the game and were working, prior to the Windows Creator Update - but they no longer work, not even in the Client. I do use the new client, but even then I had no problems with the mouse buttons just a week ago.
I can confirm that it's not only with a specific mouse, it's with every mouse that I test with.

I noticed which mouse buttons you were referring to in the title of your post, I was simply using the mouse button 1 as an example as to why we don't allow certain buttons to be rebound. 

Since you also mentioned that you had upgraded to the _Creator Update_, that would explain why your previous keybinds were reset, as you switched OS versions. That is a beta version of Windows and they are still working out a number of bugs. 

Still, if you'd like to try and get those buttons bound again you're more than welcome to hit us up in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) as I mentioned earlier.

I ended up reverting the Windows upgrade, simply because I found more issues and bugs with the OS update than just in League. I encourage anybody to do the same. It's very simple, open up your Settings, go to Update & Security -> Recovery -> Go back to an earlier build
But you have to do this soon, or that option won't be available for long.
**Reverting won't mess up your Windows**. It may cause some of your drivers to be outdated, if you updated them prior to the Creator Update, but otherwise you're fine.

When I got back in the game with my reverted version of Windows, I was able to reassign MB4 and MB5 and life is good again {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

well i fixed this probleme thanks to https://forums.warframe.com/topic/793049-w10-creators-update-and-mouse-buttons/?page=2
you should take a look , this is a windows update probleme (with laptop), you have to :

1. Open device manager, in the mouse section if you see two mice, disable one

2. If your mouse stopped working, re-enable it using keyboard or replugging

3. Disable the one which won't freeze your mouse

4. It should now properly detect it as a 5-button mouse

Hey guys, in some other thread someone posted a fix, just sharing with you: go to device manager, disable all other mice (mostly "HID device" or whatever the standard mouse is called). This fixed the buttons for me INGAME, not in the client. For some other people it fixed it also in the client. Hope this works for you too!
Just a heads up there's a super easy fix. Just go to device manager, go to mice, disable HID compliant mouse. Fixed it for me.

please fix! My mouse side buttons stopped working in league also....works fine in other programs. My side buttons are set to flash and TP so you can imagine I was in for quite the game when this stopped working!

For anyone who's still having this issue I've found a solution for me.

Press the Windows button and click the gear icon, go to gaming and turn off Windows gaming mode.

My MB4 and 5 work fine after doing so

I have tried evvvvvvvvvverything in the world for MONTHS and I finally have a solution that worked for me. My friend came over with his mouse (that also has hotkeys on the side). I plugged in his mouse, loaded a custom game, assigned MB5 and MB4 to my 1&2 active spots, then unplugged his mouse, and plugged mine in. Once my mouse was plugged in, I bought a ward and used my side mouse button to place it.

Hello fellow side mouse button users, i had exactly the same thing happen to me but none of the above solutions worked for me, eventually i found a solution that for some unknown reason works fine.

I installed "X-mouse button control" software because my mouse does not have any special software, and there i had to bind mouse button 4 to click button 4 and same for MB5, and ever after league has been registering my mouse button 4 & 5 again without any problems.

(my original idea was to bind the buttons to a random keyboard button like L or M but binding it specifically to button 4 & 5 solved it for me)

Hope this helps the few people still looking for diffrent solutions!

Same problem over here, mouse buttons 4 & 5 are not working anymore after Windows 10 Update. No problems in other applications. Have deleted the config files, no result, run LOL as admin, also no result.

I solved this exact problem by following the steps that a Rioter posted (I provided the link below)

Here are the steps he posted:

First, I'd like you to **log into League **then navigate to your config folder, which should be in the following directory:

C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config

Delete these two files:
- input.ini
- PersistedSettings.json

Permalink- https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/WRAM7bBh-side-mouse-buttons-not-working?comment=000000000000000000000000

(I followed all of his steps to solve my problem, This is just 1/3 of those steps. Meaning that another one of his steps may be the solution.)
